title: fetch plugin - add support for the text/csv content-type
body: Nu does not currently support `fetch` with content-type: text/csv. The expected behavior is for nu to download the file contents and display it as if a csv was opened via the file system.

title: Add space between column suggestions
body:
1. Adds a space between column suggestions, makes it easier to read

```
> help commands | get a
error: Unknown column
  ┌─ shell:1:21
  │
1 │ help commands | get a
  │                     ^
  │                     │
  │                     There isn't a column named 'a'
  │                     Perhaps you meant 'name'? Columns available: name, description, subcommands
```

title: Update bigint/bigdecimal
body:
This updates our bigint/bigdecimal dependencies. Some changes:

* bigdecimal now can fail when convert from a f64. This is expected, as not NaN/+Inf/-Inf are not representable in bigdecimal. Now, if f64 is not supported, we will return an error instead
* num_format is now out-of-date, so we can't do the locale-based format of the bigint. I had to comment out some functionality for now. Once that gets updated, we can re-enable it.

title: Fix subcommands column on `help commands`
body: This should fix the issue @fdncred got in https://github.com/nushell/nushell/pull/2575#issuecomment-695811812

title: CtrlD exits current shell
body:
Closes #2545 

CtrlD will:

1) Exit the current shell
2) If no more shell sessions exist, then it will exit the process (closes `nu`).

To reproduce:
1. `> enter help`
2. Hit CtrlD
3. Back to original shell

CtrlD will exit if there is no other shell.

title: Added test for `ls -a`
body: I thought it might be worth having an explicit test for this.

title: Context cleanup
body: This does a little bit of renaming so we don't use the generic name `Context`, but instead say what kind of context it is. This is becoming more important, as we know have different kinds of context.

title: Implement passthrough for benchmark
body:
Closes #2577 if this feature is wanted.

Add a new option -p,--passthrough to benchmark.
With this option, the benchmark command prints its results to stdout and passes the block's output to the next command in the pipeline.

title: more table themes rounded and reinforced
body: Added two more table themes that were gently lifted from https://github.com/wfxr/csview, a nice console csv viewer app.

title: Remove panics from random integer and make the constraint more idiomatic
body:
Resolves #2574

As a part of this change, I also changed the `--min X --max Y` pattern for nu ranges `X..Y`.
The original implementation was max-exclusive, the new implementation behaves as expected for the nu ranges.

The `..u64::MAX` range never generates `u64::MAX`, but we would have to change the RNG implementation for that.

title: Add global mode to str trim
body:
Solves #2564

The global mode allows skipping non-string values,
and processes rows and tables as well.

title: Include subcommands in `help commands`
body: resolves #2561

title: Exclude internal commands from 'help command'
body:
1. Exclude internal helper commands from 'help command'

There may be more internal commands that I'm missing here, can get them added here.

Closes #2567 

Note `run_external` does not display.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6572184/93650385-387ee280-f9c3-11ea-8682-52df5c0aa833.png)

title: Add system, user and idle times to benchmark command
body:
This adds more information to the benchmark command, using the `heim` crate.

Extending the `benchmark` command was mentioned in #2568.

title: Limit open streaming to non-files, and files > 32mb
body: Fixes https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/2519

title: Add replace all in str find-repleace
body: added the ability for `str find-replace` to have an `--all` or `-a` parameter to replace all occurrences of the find string.

title: Tidy up help command text
body: A small amount of tidying for the outputs that are displayed in help commands.

title: Update rustyline to latest
body: This bumps rustyline to the latest. As a result, we can no longer build with wasm support, so this also conditionally cfg's rustyline so that we won't attempt to build it in no-default-features/wasm mode.

title: Cleanup code in get and nu-value-ext
body:
Cleanup code in `get` and associated functions (and some users of the modified lower-level functions).

Split the get implementation into multiple smaller, more managable functions.
Removed some unneccessary `clones()` and vector splits.

There is still work to be done (mostly in the error generating functions), but I believe this is an improvement.

Some strange function choices were fixed as well (taking a tuple in a Fn, taking a Box<dyn FnOnce> instead of generics).

title: Remove trim in favor of str trim
body:
`str trim` has replaced `trim`, so remove the existing `trim` code

Closes #2382

title: Slim down configuration readings and nu_cli clean up.
body:
We continue refactoring nu_cli and slim down a bit configuration
readings with a naive metadata `modified` field check.

title: Make the sleep command pass data through.
body:
This should close #2551.
This PR is based on #2550 and should be merged after that.

This PR also adds another example and runs sleep tests.

title: implementing case-sensitive & case-insensitive completion matching
body:
use :

```
config set completion.style case-sensitive

config set completion.style case-insensitive

```

3 UI bugs remain in this:

```
ls -H<tab> will show red, indicating there is no match, but tabbing completes the possible match.

LS<tab> #for example, ls is not unique, therefore we can never match to it, when we run it the case has not been changed

touch Asdfa asdf 
ls asdfa, (it never completes properly)
```

title: Refactor completion trait
body:
Previously, this trait was built around rustyline's completion traits, and for `Shell` instances. Now it is built for individual completers inside of nushell that will complete a specific location based on a partial string. For example, for completing a partially typed command in the command position.

This is a first step in the direction of supporting a dynamic completion registry. The registry will allow for user-specified completions (for example, `git checkout <TAB>` could show git branches).

title: add a few more ansi escape sequences
body: some of these are specifically there to help set the title cross platform using ansi escape sequences. the erase sequences there are for play - +1 for fun. maybe eventually we'll have the entire list of escape sequences so people can do animations and such via ansi.

title: Make the sleep command respond to Ctrl+C
body:
This solves issue #2546.

The internal sleep command is now implemented by a custom future.

The future spawns a thread that sleeps for the given duration, and
completes the future normally in that time.

The future also spawns a second thread that polls for Cltr+C presses.
If Ctrl+C occures, the future is finished early.

title: Ctrl c exit issue
body: fixes #2038 and perhaps #2461

title: Update rawkey for ARM support
body: v0.1.2 of rawkey currently doesn't compile on ARM; v0.1.3 remedies this.

title: Core nu plugin load capability.
body:
We introduce the `plugin` nu sub command (`nu plugin`) with basic plugin
loading support. We can choose to load plugins from a directory. Originally
introduced to make integration tests faster (by not loading any plugins on startup at all)
but `nu plugin --load some_path ; test_pipeline_that_uses_plugins_just_loaded` does not see it.

Therefore, a `nu_with_plugins!` macro for tests was introduced on top of nu`s `--skip-plugins`
switch executable which is set to true when running the integration tests that use the `nu!` macro now..

title: Simplify a few boolean creations
body: Small refactor to simplify the creation of some boolean objects

title: Implement exclusive and inclusive ranges with ..< and ..
body:
This commit adds right-exclusive ranges. #2459

The original a..b inclusive syntax was changed to exclusive to reflect the Rust notation.
New a..=b syntax was introduced to have the old behavior.

Currently, both `a..` and `a..=` is valid, and it is unclear to me whether it's valid
to impose restrictions here.

The original issue suggests .. for inclusive and ..< for exclusive ranges,
this can be implemented by making simple changes to this PR.

title: Set active shell column to boolean
body:
Closes #2539 

1.  Set active shell column to boolean
2. Helper to convert bool to primitive

`> shells | where active == $true`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6572184/93007192-c87fe080-f51a-11ea-9df3-ec3921283b3d.png)

title: support key-value argument in with-env(#2490)
Allow `math avg` to work on durations
body:
issue #2511 

Extend `math avg` to be able to handle durations

Example:
`> echo 1sec 1ms | math avg`
`500ms 500us`

title: accept multiple variables in with-env(#2490)
Fix path completions for `cd` command.
body: Previously, we weren't expanding `~`, so `std::fs::metadata` was failing. We now make use of `PathSuggestion` to get the actual path, as represented by a `PathBuf`. This allows us to fetch the metadata and properly filter out anything that isn't a directory.

title: Clarify duration conversion
body: Some minor updates to the duration conversion code, I tried to address the FIXMEs earlier but those ended up being a failed experiment 😂

title: remove unused dependencies
body: based on `cargo udeps` I have removed unused dependencies. I test by compiling with `--all-targets` and `--all-features` in `--release` mode.

title: updated dependencies
body:
Using `cargo upgrade --workspace` I updated all the dependencies at once. There were lots of problems compiling afterward but I reversed the problem children and left those "hard ones" for @jonathandturner :) But a lot got upgraded.

The "hard ones" are [listed here](https://gist.githubusercontent.com/fdncred/a7aecb56193285968bc8a412082ab35b/raw/bb899c65802ad32d335cc81c0642861f83f65001/depends_to_fix.txt).

title: Allow decimals as a range boundary
body:
With this, you can have a decimal as a range boundary, like this:

```
> echo 1..10.5
```

You may not necessarily use this directly, but it becomes important as you consider using math to create a boundary.  Something like this:

```
> echo 5 | echo 1..$($it / 2)
```

would not have previously stopped and would have continued iterating.

title: `each group` and `each window` subcommands.
body:
Fixes #2395. 

1. Implements the `each group` and `each window` subcommands. 
- Groups: `echo [1 2 3 4 5 6] | each group 3 { echo $it } | to json` returns `[[1,2,3],[4,5,6]]`
- Windows: `echo [1 2 3 4] | each window 3 { echo $it } | to json` returns `[[1,2,3],[2,3,4]]`
- Windows w/ Stride: `echo [1 2 3 4 5 6] | each window 3 -s 2 { echo $it } | to json` returns `[[1,2,3],[3,4,5]]`.

title: Add cpu time to ps -l
body:
1. Add `cpu_time` to `ps -l` output

The cpu time includes both user + system time. I believe this matches the Unix `ps` `time` column.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6572184/92345748-7a349280-f07f-11ea-9e3a-d592875c1b2c.png)


Example command to find processes with the highest cpu time:

`ps -l | sort-by cpu_time | last 10`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6572184/92345552-a7347580-f07e-11ea-983b-1b37551075b6.png)

title: Improve range parsing and handling
body:
This improves ranges a few different ways:

* You can now use variables in a range. For example:

```
> echo 10 | echo 1..$it
```

Variables can be variable paths.

* We now also support open-ended ranges, like `1..` and `..10`

title: Add modulo operator and simplify in/not-in
body:
This does two things:

* introduces a new `mod` operator to do modulo operations. eg) `= 9 mod 2`

* renames `in:` and `not-in:` to `in` and `not-in`. The colon was there originally to help disambiguate, but in math mode it's not ambiguous. There may be cases of it being visually ambiguous, which we'll need watch for, but should generally be easier to use and read (with any luck)

title: Show completions more than one level below ~
body: Previously, we'd check for a `~/` prefix and then return the home directory as the base `PathBuf`. We failed to consider pushing any of the other possible path components into this base dir, which prevent completions more than one level deep (for example, `~/.config/<TAB>` would fail).

title: pr to get my main in sync
Weather chars
body: added weather chars. useful for constructing prompts with the weather

title: Interpreting ranges for substring
body:
The changes addresses the points stated in #2493 
I guess this is a more pythonic way of interpreting ranges in slices.

- [x] echo 'good nushell' | str substring '5,12' -> stays the same, returns nushell
- [x] echo 'good nushell' | str substring ',-5' -> changed -5 always means 5th char from the end, so it goes from 0 to length - 5 and returns good nu
- [x] echo 'good nushell' | str substring '5,' -> stays the same, returns nushell
- [x] echo 'good nushell' | str substring ',7' -> stays the same, returns good nu
- [x] echo 'good nushell' | str substring '-5,' -> changed -5 always means 5th char from the end, so it goes from length - 5 to the end and returns shell
- [x] echo 'good nushell' | str substring '-3,-5' -> changed this would try to go from length - 3 to length - 5 and throw the End must be greater than or equal to Start error

title: Remove space from command name completion suggestion.
body: Although convenient, since the user doesn't have to type the space, it could be a little surprising to users since they may think that was the only completion in certain completions modes (for example, `circular`).

title: Provide path as part of the suggestion from the path completer.
body:
This greatly simplifies the consumption of path suggestions when the caller wants to filter those suggestions. Returning the underlying `Path` means the replacement can maintain path elements that nushell understands, but `std::path` and `std::fs` do not. For example, `~/` for the user's home directory, `...` for two directories above, and so on.

[EDIT]
This also appears to fix directory suggestions in the command position (for "auto cd")

title: Num links added to ls -l output
body:
1. Num links added to `ls -l` output

This information is displayed in the Unix `ls -l` command, thought it would be useful to include in this table as well.

Screenshot from running `ls -l` in `nu`:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6572184/92314187-6eff3b00-ef89-11ea-8986-31f382da473f.png)

title: implement exec for unix platforms
body:
Fix for #1799 by implementing a `exec` built-in using the `std::os::unix::process::CommandExt` trait.

NOTE: one thing I couldn't figure out how to do is for the exec args to allow `-param` passing, e.g. `exec /some/cmd do_something` works but `exec /some/cmd --param` won't because the parser thinks `--param` is for `exec`.

title: Ensure ansi mode windows
body:
when running external commands ansi mode seems to get messed up. so, adding this one change seems to fix the issue. This was my test case.

`echo [14 15 16] | wrap decimal | update decimal $(echo $it.decimal | str from | echo $(printf %x $it))`

title: Update clipboard feature
body: two places reference feature `clipboard` and i thought the feature was called `clipboard-cli` but i'm not sure it makes a difference.

title: Initial implementation of random integer subcommand.
body:
This is the initial implementation of the random integer subcommand.
It's a very simple first step, allowing specification of min and max values.

I have plans to add a couple more options, like "--signed", specifying a range "10..100", but wanted to get an initial version in place first.

title: use fs_extra to recursively move folders
body: Fixes #2470 by using `fs_extra` to do the recursive copy/remove in case `std::fs::rename` could not be used.

title: Size: count unicode graphmemes as single char
body:
Closes #2465 

This change uses the [UnicodeSegmentation crate](https://crates.io/crates/unicode-segmentation) to iterate over the content as unicode graphmemes instead of a Rust char. This prevents a single visual Unicode graphmeme from getting split into several chars and affecting the counts.

I used TDD with a sample test case from the issue, which also helps clarify as an example.

title: Default alignment
body: fixed bug that allowed bogus defaults to get set. should be working now with expected colors and alignment when no config exists or config isn't set.

title: Support ~ (home directory) in completions.
body:
This requires a bit of a hack in command completions, since we don't expand `~` for the replacement, just long enough to get child entries.

I can't think of a great way to handle this right now, but likely we'll want the path completer to have a separate method that returns path objects. The command completer can then convert those into `Suggestion`s.

title: Color info for config.toml
body: just a few notes on what color and attributes one can apply in the config.toml

title: More bug fixes for completions
body:
Fixes https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/2475

Fixes two completion bugs.

The first bug is where one tries to complete

    ls <TAB>

but would have the entire line replaced. This was due to use of an unknown `Span`, when really we know the replacement should occur at the cursor, which is exactly the fix that we made.

The second occurs in circular completion mode, where one cycles through suggestions. When moving from a longer suggestion to a shorter one, we'd see some of the old suggestion lingering around. A previous change to the update behaviour was reverted, so this no longer is a problem, but reintroduces buggy behaviour when completion is requested in the middle of an argument.

title: Improve support for completing within quotes.
body:
Fixes https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/2136

We ensure the partially cimpleted item doesn't include the end quote. We also ensure that the appropriate span is replaced, not just the suggested position up to the cursor position.

title: Size command: rename max length to bytes
body:
Since "max length" is just getting the byte length, rename it to `bytes`
in order to be more clear. 

This was discussed in https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/2465.

title: Add examples to uniq
body: Add examples to the `uniq` command, one with the -c flag and one without

title: Only requote path arguments.
body:
Requoting negatively impacted command completions, which end in a space. This resulted in quotes getting added unnecessarily to command completions that did not need them.

Two important things to note here:

1. This isn't an ideal solution. The command completer adding a space at the end is a convenience, but it would make more sense for `NuCompleter` to do this, not the individual completers. It has more context to make such a decision.
2. We need tests 😬

title: Tables with love
body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/343840/91739590-c3647e00-eb77-11ea-9749-714ae91a44f2.png)

title: added compact_double table theme for funsies
body:
Just for fun - change `table_mode = compact_double` and you'll get this.
```
═══╦════════════════════════╦══════╦══════════╦══════════════
 # ║          name          ║ type ║   size   ║   modified
═══╬════════════════════════╬══════╬══════════╬══════════════
 0 ║ ..\cargo-commands.txt  ║ File ║   2.8 KB ║ 2 months ago
 1 ║ ..\foo.csv             ║ File ║ 156.5 KB ║ 1 month ago
 2 ║ ..\ichwh-rs            ║ Dir  ║   4.1 KB ║ 1 month ago
 3 ║ ..\install_nushell.cmd ║ File ║   1.6 KB ║ 2 weeks ago
 4 ║ ..\nushell             ║ Dir  ║   8.2 KB ║ 20 hours ago
 5 ║ ..\rustyline           ║ Dir  ║   4.1 KB ║ 1 month ago
═══╩════════════════════════╩══════╩══════════╩══════════════
```

title: Tolerate os error while executing ls command
body:
issue #2460 

Nushell doesn't forgive OS error while executing ls command and will error out.
I fixed this behavior and ls command shows all available files now.

title: Improve quoting for path completions.
body:
- Ensure quotes surround suggestion replacement when there are spaces.
- Ensure an appropriate quote character is chosen based on other quoting characters being in the suggestions.

title: Add a custom path completer to nushell.
body:
Previously, we used rustyline's filename completer. This allowed us to make progress on the completion engine without building all the parts at once. We now need our own filename completer to make progress.

The primary driver to having our own filename completer is that it can better integrate with our path constructs. For example, if we have

    > ls .../<TAB>

we want to show a list of suggestions that includes all files two directories up from the current working directory. The least jarring experience to a user would be to maintain the three dots. With a lot of back and forth transformations, we _could_ make this work with rustyline, but I think the easiest way for us to do this is by building our own completer and path constructs. It also removes a dependency on `rustyline`, in case we ever wanted to try other crates, or build our own readline-like crate.

title: Set auto-pivot to never by default
body: We've had feedback from a few folks that pivoting a table when it's not expected can be very disorienting. It's better to less attractive but also less confusing as the default. Once people understand Nu better, they can explore turning on auto pivot.

title: Minor updates to variance
body:
This is equivalent to the merged [stddev PR](https://github.com/nushell/nushell/pull/2452) except for variance. 

1. Prefer `?` to bare `Err` match
2. Add an example of sample variance

title: Changing the directory to '.' doesn't modify the prompt anymore
body:
Doing 'cd .' or an equal command used to modify the prompt: It appended an './' and was even
repeatable, leading to strange prompts (believe me, I tested it for too long).

This fixes #2432

title: Add support for multiline rustyline edits
body:
Adds support for multiline edits. We key whether we should continue to multiple lines if we get the parse error "unexpected EOF", meaning that there is an unclosed paren/curly/quote/etc.

This allows us to span tables, blocks, and more across multiple rustyline lines. For example:

```
> echo [
[Name, Age];
[JT, 42]
]
───┬──────┬─────
 # │ Name │ Age 
───┼──────┼─────
 0 │ JT   │  42 
───┴──────┴─────
```

You can use `do` as well to span a pipeline across lines:

```
> do {
ls |
get name
}
────┬────────────────────
  0 │ CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md 
  1 │ CONTRIBUTING.md    
  2 │ Cargo.lock         
...
```

title: Light fixes
body:
* Addes it-expansion for tables
* Fixes https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/2442

title: Add optional commas for items in lists and tables
body:
Adds the ability to put a comma after items in a table or list:

```
> echo [[name, height]; [Jonathan, 185]]
───┬──────────┬────────
 # │   name   │ height 
───┼──────────┼────────
 0 │ Jonathan │    185 
───┴──────────┴────────
```

and

```
> echo [1, 2, 3]
───┬───
 0 │ 1 
 1 │ 2 
 2 │ 3 
───┴───
```

title: Add table literals
body:
This adds table literals. Tables look similar to lists, but have an additional header list separated from the data by a `;`:

```
> echo [[name age] ; [bob 13] [sally 20]]
───┬───────┬─────
 # │ name  │ age 
───┼───────┼─────
 0 │ bob   │  13 
 1 │ sally │  20 
───┴───────┴─────
```

title: Minor stddev updates
body:
Minor updates to the stddev command:

1. Add an example for getting the sample stddev
2. Opt for `?` instead of generic Err match

title: Add minor theme support
body:
working except for table lines. I really have no idea why table lines aren't being colored. I've validated that the color style is set and I can write an output string with that color style in the assigned color however at runtime it doesn't color them. maybe a bug in my code or in ansi_term, who knows. would appreciate some eyes on this. i'm sure there will be lots of suggested changes.

changes to config.toml
```
[color_config]
primitive_int = "green"
primitive_decimal = "red"
primitive_filesize = "blue"
primitive_string = "purple"
primitive_line = "yellow"
primitive_columnpath = "cyan"
primitive_pattern = "white"
primitive_boolean = "green"
primitive_date = "red"
primitive_duration = "blue"
primitive_range = "purple"
primitive_path = "yellow"
primitive_binary = "cyan"
separator_color = "purple"
header_align = "l" # left|l, right|r, center|c
header_color = "c" # green|g, red|r, blue|u, black|b, yellow|y, purple|p, cyan|c, white|w
header_bold = true
header_style = "cb"
index_color = "r"
```
breaking changes to config.toml
moved `header_color`, `header_bold`, and `header_align` into the `color_config` group

still lots of cleanup to do. green code everywhere (comments). not very rust idomatic but considering a c# person wrote it, that is to be expected. :)`

title: CONTRIBUTING: useful commands as list
body: Just a style change, I don't know if you like it :)

title: Add missing math commands to docs
body:
I noticed a few existing math commands aren't mentioned in the docs, so I added them.

One thing I noticed is that `stddev` doesn't truncate floating point, it ends up being huge, is this intended?

```
echo [1 4 6 10 50] | math stddev
18.1372544780074142289927665486772038998991290109304180183807006388780888095751453498123844567330072
```

title: Show directories and executable for command completion.
body:
Fixes https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/2393

Previously we chose from two sets for completing the command position:

1. internal commands, and
2. executables relative to the PATH environment variable.

We now also show directories/executables that match the relative/absolute path that has been partially typed.

title: Create benign email test fixture
body:
The previous one was an old ebay email and flagged by AVs as phishing. 

I created a very simple example email, if there are some headers missing, I can add them in. I stuck to the ones needed by the tests.

Closes #2397

title: Ensure command name available for Argument completion locations
body:
Fixing half of a TODO to ensure argument completion location have the relevant command name.

**Approach**
Keep track of the command we're currently parsing. If we can't map to a command location, and it doesn't look to be in the command position, we assume we're in the most recently observed command.

title: Fix out of bounds in header command when row size is different
body:
Fixes: https://github.com/nushell/nushell/issues/2412

It's a draft PR because I have some questions:
1. I can't get the unittest to fail, could it be that it's ignoring panics? If so, please let me know how to fix that.
2. Do we want to ignore values outside of header bounds or do we want to merge the last value in the last row?

title: Remove unnecessary reference to ichwh in command completer
body: As discovered by @fdncred, this dependency on `ichwh` was 100% unnecessary. Replaced with a simple `Option`.

title: Slim down CLI logic.
body: Another step forward to continue splitting functionality. Despacito.

title: make cd command complete only folders
body:
fix #2370 

Currently the cd command autocompletes all files and directories in the working directory.
However, it should only autocomplete folders.
I removed filenames from completion results when we use cd command.

title: added -e --end to search from the end of the string for the pattern
body: just use `rfind` in place of `find`

title: cleaned up sample ps1 script and added more comments.
body:
It's not complete but a good start for anyone interested in learning. However, it should still output the length of a string when following these steps:

1. Put the ps1 script in the same folder where `nu` is or
2. Update the plugin_dirs config.toml array with the folder that contains the ps1 plugin
3. Start or Restart nu
4. Type this `echo "123" | mylen`

title: Path dirname and filestem
body: added two new path sub commands `dirname` and `filestem`. Also had to hack on @thegedge 's completions because it wouldn't compile on windows with `cargo b`.  tons of tests are failing but i'm submitting anyway. will fix later.

title: Command especific configuration extraction baseline.
body: `autoview` and `table` commands extend config with what they need.

title: Allow invocations and fix span error reporting.
body:
The same applies to `insert` command. Error reporting (correct spans) improved. Second example was not possible before. Need to investigate more regarding the difference when using invocation vs block. It seems that when using an invocation in a named param, implementation wise the `input` is nothing. To solve it, the input value is taken from the scope's `it` value.

```
Ⲗ > echo '{age: 20}' | from json | update age 10
─────┬────
 age │ 10
─────┴────

 Ⲗ > echo '{age: 20}' | from json | update age $(= $it.age + 10)
─────┬────
 age │ 30
─────┴────

 Ⲗ > echo '{age: 20}' | from json | update age { = $it.age + 10 }
─────┬────
 age │ 30
─────┴────
```

title: Move alias type inference (experimental) behind --infer/-i flag
body: "Fixes" #2416: aliases should work as previously unless -i flag is set.
